thread.title: ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S with Android Nougat and 5,000mAh battery unveiled
thread.title_full: ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S with Android Nougat and 5,000mAh battery unveiled

title: ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S with Android Nougat and 5,000mAh battery unveiled
text:
ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S with Android Nougat and 5,000mAh battery unveiled ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S with Android Nougat and 5,000mAh battery unveiled By January 9, 2017 “The Pegasus 3S features an octa-core SoC, 3GB of RAM and 13MP/8MP cameras” 
In June last year, ASUS unveiled the ZenFone Pegasus 3 in China. The phone featured a premium design and a 4,100mAh battery. Now the company has unveiled another smartphone in the series called the ZenFone Pegasus 3S in China. The phone comes with an even beefier 5,000mAh battery. 
The ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S flaunts a metal unibody design, and gets a fingerprint sensor that’s integrated into its home button. The phone features a 5.2-inch IPS HD display with a 2.5D curved glass on top. It is powered by an octa-core 64-bit MediaTek MT6750 processor, mated to 3GB of RAM. It comes in two storage variants – 32GB and 64GB, which also supports microSD cards up to 2TB. 
The ZenFone Pegasus 3S features a 13-megapixel primary snapper with phase detection autofocus and a dual-LED flash. For selfies and video calling, the phone gets an 8-megapixel front-facing shooter. Connectivity-wise, it offers 4G, VoLTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS. The 5,000mAh battery under the hood is capable of delivering up to 30 days of standby time and 48 hours of usage, and supports fast charging. Software-wise, the phone boots Android Nougat out of the box. 
The 64GB variant of the ASUS ZenFone Pegasus 3S has been priced at RMB 1,999, which is roughly Rs 19,600. There’s no word on the price of the 32GB model as of now. The phone will go on sale in China later this month.
